materials.raw_text: B: 40 g, Mn: 30 g, Nb: 15 g, Ti: 100 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Boron powder can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online marketplaces. Mn: Manganese powder is available at metal supply stores or online. Nb: Niobium powder can be sourced from specialty metal suppliers. Ti: Titanium powder is available from metal supply or chemical supply stores.

Nb: Niobium powder can be sourced from specialty metal suppliers. Ti: Titanium powder is available from metal supply or chemical supply stores.

1. Measure 40 g of boron powder. 2. Measure 30 g of manganese powder. 3. Measure 15 g of niobium powder. 4. Measure 100 g of titanium powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle until the composition is uniform.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 40 g of boron powder. 2. Measure 30 g of manganese powder. 3. Measure 15 g of niobium powder. 4. Measure 100 g of titanium powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle until the composition is uniform.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until fully cooled to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until fully cooled to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a sanding tool to smooth out any rough edges from the surface. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating if required for further use. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, cool place.
